sen.j: 加茂町（かもちょう）は、京都府相楽郡にあった町である。
sen.e: Kamo-cho was a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kamo-cho was a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Kamo-cho was a town located in Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2007年3月12日、山城町 (京都府)、木津町と合併し木津川市となった。
sen.e: On March 12, 2007 Kamo-cho was merged with Yamashiro-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Kizu-cho, thereby forming Kizugawa City.
On March 12, 2007 Kamo-cho was merged with Yamashiro-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Kizu-cho, thereby forming Kizugawa City.
On March 12, 2007 Kamo-cho was merged with Yamashiro-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Kizu-cho, thereby forming Kizugawa City.

sen.j: 奈良時代の一時期、都（恭仁京）が置かれたという歴史があり、多数の史跡・文化財を有する。
sen.e: As the capital (Kuni-kyo) was located around this area for a period of time in Nara Period, the area has many historical sites and cultural assets.
As the capital (Kuni-kyo) was located around this area for a period of time in Nara Period, the area has many historical sites and cultural assets.
As the capital (Kuni-kyo) was located around this area for a period of time in the Nara period, the area has many historical sites and cultural assets.
sen.cmt: period 小文字にしました。"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: 日本最初の流通貨幣「和同開珎」が造られた地でもある。
sen.e: The first currency in circulation in Japan, 'Wado-Kaichin silver coins,' was made in this area.
The first currency in circulation in Japan, 'Wado-Kaichin silver coins,' was made in this area.
The first currency in circulation in Japan, 'Wado-Kaichin silver coins,' was made in this area.

sen.j: 「文化が薫る暮らしよい町」を町の標語に掲げていた。
sen.e: The town adopted a motto 'Town rich in culture and is comfortable to live.'
The town adopted a motto 'Town rich in culture and is comfortable to live.'
The town adopted a motto 'Town rich in culture and is comfortable to live.'

sen.j: 特産品は、壁紙、襖、茶、椎茸。
sen.e: Local products are wallpaper, Fusuma door, tea, and shiitake mushrooms.
Local products are wallpaper, Fusuma door, tea, and shiitake mushrooms.
Local products are wallpaper, Fusuma door, tea, and shiitake mushrooms.

sen.j: 729年（天平元年） 聖武天皇の勅願により岩船寺創建。
sen.e: In 729, the Gansen-ji Temple was built by the order of Emperor Shomu.
In 729, the Gansen-ji Temple was built by the order of Emperor Shomu.
729: The Gansen-ji Temple was built by the order of the Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: "the" を挿入しました。「"On"を使わない日付+半角コロン+半角スペース+文章」の形式に変更しました。

sen.j: 735年（天平7年） 聖武天皇の勅願により海住山寺創建。
sen.e: In 735, the Kaijisen-ji Temple was built by the order of Emperor Shomu.
In 735, the Kaijisen-ji Temple was built by the order of Emperor Shomu.
735: The Kaijusen-ji Temple was built by the order of the Emperor Shomu.
sen.cmt: 同上スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 740年（天平12年） 聖武天皇による恭仁京遷都。
sen.e: In 740, the Emperor Shomu relocated the capital to Kuni-kyo.
In 740, the Emperor Shomu relocated the capital to Kuni-kyo.
740: The Emperor Shomu relocated the capital to Kuni-kyo.

sen.j: 744年（天平16年） 難波宮に遷都され、恭仁宮跡は山城国分寺となる。
sen.e: In 744, the capital was relocated to Naniwanomiya Palace and the Yamashiro provincial monastery was built at the site of Kuni-kyo.
In 744, the capital was relocated to Naniwanomiya Palace and the Yamashiro provincial monastery was built at the site of Kuni-kyo.
744: The capital was relocated to Naniwanomiya Palace and the Yamashiro provincial monastery was built at the site of Kuni-kyo.

sen.j: 1047年（永承2年） 浄瑠璃寺創建。
sen.e: In 1047 the Joruri-ji Temple was built.
In 1047 the Joruri-ji Temple was built.
1047: The Joruri-ji Temple was built.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 相楽郡里村、高田村、法華寺野村、大野村、観音寺村、美浪村、銭司村、兎並村、北村が合併して加茂村誕生。
sen.e: On April 1, 1889 Sato-mura of Soraku-gun, Takada-mura, Hokkejino-mura, Ono-mura, Kannonji-mura, Minami-mura, Zezu-mura, Unami-mura, and Kita-mura were merged to form Kamo-mura.
On April 1, 1889 Sato-mura of Soraku-gun, Takada-mura, Hokkejino-mura, Ono-mura, Kannonji-mura, Minami-mura, Zezu-mura, Unami-mura, and Kita-mura were merged to form Kamo-mura.
April 1, 1889: Sato-mura, Takada-mura, Hokkejino-mura, Ono-mura, Kannonji-mura, Minami-mura, Zezu-mura, Unami-mura, and Kita-mura of Soraku-gun were merged to form Kamo-mura.
sen.cmt: 同上相楽郡の場所を移動しました。

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年） 2月11日 町制施行。
sen.e: On February 11, 1928 the town organization took effect.
On February 11, 1928 the town organization took effect.
February 11, 1928: The town organization took effect.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）4月1日 相楽郡当尾村（とうのむら）、瓶原村（みかのはらむら）を編入。
sen.e: On April 1, 1951 Tono-mura of Soraku-gun and Mikanohara-mura were incorporated into Kamo-mura.
On April 1, 1951 Tono-mura of Soraku-gun and Mikanohara-mura were incorporated into Kamo-mura.
April 1, 1951: Tono-mura and Mikanohara-mura of Soraku-gun were incorporated into Kamo-mura.
sen.cmt: 同上相楽郡の場所を移動しました。

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月12日 山城、木津、加茂3町が合併して木津川市誕生。
sen.e: On March 12, 2007 Yamashiro, Kizu, and Kamo were merged to form Kizugawa City.
On March 12, 2007 Yamashiro, Kizu, and Kamo were merged to form Kizugawa City.
March 12, 2007: Three towns of Yamashiro, Kizu, and Kamo were merged to form Kizugawa City.

sen.j: 奈良県の県庁・奈良市に隣接していることから、大きな影響を受けている。
sen.e: Adjacent to the prefectural government of Nara Prefecture, Nara City, Kamo-cho has been greatly affected.
